availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Benjamin M. Winston (Union County, Kentucky, merchant, postmaster, and soldier)

body.p: Union County, Kentucky, merchant, postmaster, and soldier. Virginia native. Married to Annie Elizabeth Long Winston in Union County on September 26, 1850. Father of Charles Winston, Louisa Winston, Virginia Winston, and William Winston. Merchant in Union County in 1850. Postmaster in Caseyville, Kentucky from July 6, 1853 to June 26, 1855. Merchant in Union County in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861. Served in Winston's Scouts (C.S.A.) as a captain from 1861 to 1865.
